results.noStrengths: You're building your foundation across all dimensions. Focus on developing the ability to work independently in areas that align with your career goals.
results.noImprovements: Excellent! All dimensions score 4 or above. You have strong competencies across the board. Develop your expertise in the areas of your choosing.

careerPaths.none: Continue developing your skills to match specific career paths. This list is not exhaustive—if you'd like to see additional roles added, please contact us at info@locessentials.com

recommendations.gilt: Gain experience in practical translation and localization projects. Study internationalization best practices and globalization strategy.
recommendations.management: Get translation and localization project management training. Practice managing small translation projects or teams.
recommendations.technology: Familiarize yourself with specific technologies like Lilt, Subtitle Edit and LLMs. Learn about machine translation post-editing and study programming languages like Python.
recommendations.language: Improve your proficiency in your working languages. Develop your intercultural competency so that you can contribute to work that is culturally sensitive.
recommendations.subject: Focus on a specific industry (creative, technical, legal) and develop expertise in a niche area in that domain. Learn about legal requirements and how data security impacts international communication.
recommendations.research: Grow in this area by reading research studies in areas of interest and by doing your own linguistic, cultural, or technological research. Find a place to publish about your work.
recommendations.market: Develop a deep understanding of your source and target markets in the specializations in which you work. Follow a diverse range of industry experts. Learn about localization industry standards (ISO 17100, ASTM F2575).
recommendations.highPerformer:
Work to maintain your current levels. Areas in which near constant evolution is needed include:

Languages/Markets - The more time a person occupies in a language and society, the more aware they are of current language usage and societal trends.

Research & Critical Thinking - These competencies are at risk when one develops an over-reliance on AI, according to some.

Subject Matters - People's interests naturally develop over time, and when people work to develop competency in a new subject matter, that's positive even if the competency score is low.

GILT - These are four big topics, better tackled through a team approach.

Technology - Tech is developing rapidly, amidst a constant rage for and against the machines.

Management - The way we work with people will naturally evolve alongside the people we work with.

Wishing you success!

alerts.incomplete: Please complete all ratings before calculating your results.
alerts.email: In a real implementation, this would send your results to your email. For now, please use the Print option.
